instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> was shorted at <CAPACITOR>C7900</CAPACITOR> to ground, injected power, and it heated up, under microscope it was obvious damaged,

<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> Pin 1 -1.6v-1.7v, Pin 2 0v, pin 3 1.49v-1.6v

<DIODE>D7005</DIODE> on diod mode Pin 2 - 0.13, Pin 3 0.33

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.18V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>: 0.0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 0.0V

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL>: 0.0v

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>: 0.18V


<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>: 0.18V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
Which is the resistance to ground at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 rails now?
Also check at pin 3 of <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>.
Post <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message: Tried known good DC in board and OEM Chargers for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
resistance to ground <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.62, 3V42  - 0.18V

<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> pin 2,3 - 1.8V,   Pin 5,6 1.9V, Pin 4 0.22V

Resistance to ground------------
<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> pin 2,3 - 75.2,   Pin 5,6 34.34, Pin 4 21.99

Known DC working, tried multiple ones

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
Seems that charger detects leakage and gets blocked.

You should have aprox 68k at pin5/<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> to ground; the value of <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>.
Check if <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is open, or shorted to ground.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> last posted values are in ohms, kohms, diode mode???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> are kohms,

and <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is not found, could have been mis written ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on ppbus, repaired and still no green light
threads.message: problem was <DIODE>D7010</DIODE>, it was a bit damaged for some reason, so im guessing it was not opening, another sucessful repair, thank you guys so much, specially you 2informaticos!!
